meanings.definition: To shock or greatly surprise someone.
meanings.sent1: The magician's disappearing act will astound the audience.
meanings.sent2: The unexpected plot twist in the movie will astound viewers.
meanings.sent3: The talking dog will astound the neighbors during the talent show.
meanings.sent4: The beauty of the sunset never fails to astound me.
meanings.sent5: The grand fireworks display will astound everyone at the celebration.

meanings.sent1: The talented singer's performance will astound the judges.
meanings.sent2: The intricate details of the artwork will astound art enthusiasts.
meanings.sent3: The cat's ability to play the piano will astound the online viewers.
meanings.sent4: The speed of the cheetah will astound anyone witnessing it in person.
meanings.sent5: The vastness of the universe never fails to astound scientists and astronomers.
